page.title: 16MR COOPER'S MEMORIES.
page.content: My first impression of Uckfield when I arrived in September 1918 ferried by a{Model T.Ford Taxi}with polished brass radiator and cap, was of a one sided, one street town,for town it was. We had a{market}every Wednesday and cattle were driven down through the High Street to the site below Gateways. The old gas standards lighted the town and the old{lamplighter}used to go round with his long pole at dusk and dawn. He used to have less to do at dawn because some of the boys used to shin up the lamppost and put them out.If the local bobby,{P.C. {Pearce},by name, used to catch any, he gave us a slash with the old cape he always carried. This was accepted as a just punishment and I must say I never remember any violence or vandalism at all in that period.
